Returns: The total number of items in this adapter.
getItemCount().Description: Returns the total number of items in the data set held by the adapter.

getFacetProvider(int).Description: Queries @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FacetProvider_E@ for a given type within Adapter.

Returns: A new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type.
Parameters: ViewGroup: The ViewGroup into which the new View will be added after it is bound to an adapter position.
int: The view type of the new View.
onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGrou.Description: @B_android#view#View#OnFocusChangeListener_E@ that assigned in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Presenter#onCreateViewHolder_E@ may be chained, user should never change @B_android#view#View#OnFocusChangeListener_E@ after that.

Returns: the stable ID of the item at position
getItemId(int).Description: Return the stable ID for the item at position. If @B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView#Adapter#hasStableIds_E@ would return false this method should return @B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView#NO_ID_E@. The default implementation of this method returns @B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView#NO_ID_E@.

Returns: integer value identifying the type of the view needed to represent the item at position. Type codes need not be contiguous.
getItemViewType(int).Description: Return the view type of the item at position for the purposes of view recycling. The default implementation of this method returns 0, making the assumption of a single view type for the adapter. Unlike ListView adapters, types need not be contiguous. Consider using id resources to uniquely identify item view types.

ClassDesc: Bridge from @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Presenter_E@ to @B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView#Adapter_E@. Public to allow use by third party Presenters.
